column4: hi. My sata drive keeps giving me problems. It is ext3. I am running fsck /dev/sda2 -y . is this ok? I see that some people run fsck.ext3.. Am I doing this wrong???
is it safe to 'fsck /drive' on ext3 ?
I think there's no -y argument, try fsck /dev/sda2
thanks...   -y that means 'answer yes to all questions'
